page.title: 09Ecology Continued.
page.content: The many willow fringed streams give the area a "tree-lined" aspect. The name "Coldharbour" still exists in the fields, where once the cold harbour providing shade and refreshment for beasts, yet nothing for humans, gave a welcome break on long journeys. However the elms that gave shelter in the past have now had to be replaced owing to Dutch elm disease. On the railway embankment and in the lanes and bridleways the flora contains horsetails, ribwort, spurrey, creeping buttercup, sow thistle, cornflower, dandelion, nettle, mustard, scarlet pimpernel, hoary pepperwort, cat's ear, dog daisy, black birdweed, shepherd's purse, ragwort, campion, charlock, chickweed, dock, cranesbill, speedwell and many others. Conservation is important to the people in the area.
